intro: Hiraea finlaysoniana, commonly known as the Finlayson's hiraea, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of Central America. It belongs to the family Meliaceae, which includes mahogany and related trees. The plant is characterized by its simple, alternate leaves and small, inconspicuous flowers that are typically greenish-yellow in color. It produces small, woody fruits that contain one or two seeds. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
